column5: While everyone else around here has been crowding the banks, shoulder to shoulder, I've been busy harassing the perch and pike without too much trouble. Have not taken too many pics.  Have enough trouble keeping the theiving dog from biting into every perch or diving in after the pike. Was a little cold out for the dog to go swimming. There have not been the numbers like up on Simcoe, but there certainly has been the quality.
Well where I fish is rarely shoulder to shoulder--but I gotta say Ugli those are some sweet perch (schwarzenegger perch). They certainly ain't no "two-bite brownies!!"
Yum...  Haven't had a feed of perch in months
Tasty lookin little critters they is I love catchiing them as much as i like eatin them.
i love catching big fall panfish
I was thinking last Sunday was my last boatride for perch this fall...but now after seeing your pictures ...I might have to haul her up for one last go tomorrow.  Glad you and the pooch got out.
I'm assuming you were on Erie. I've wanted to give perch a try out there but never got around to it. I had my boat in chippawa all summer but never got out to Erie.
Shore perchin in Niagara will go into December. Water has not got cold yet.
